and some other instances, copied over from NNReal

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

### PR summary [8314b49d1a](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22849/commits/8314b49d1a809317adee3d78631e9b10037fdca7)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ dist_eq`
`+ instance : ContinuousSub ℚ≥0`
`+ instance : HasContinuousInv₀ ℚ≥0 := inferInstance`
`+ instance : IsTopologicalSemiring ℚ≥0`
`+ instance : MetricSpace ℚ≥0`
`+ instance : OrderTopology ℚ≥0 := orderTopology_of_ordConnected (t := Set.Ici 0)`
`+ nndist_eq`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Thanks!

bors merge

bors r-

Please add the lemmas characterizing `dist` and `nndist` in terms of the coercion to the rationals

bors d+

:v: pechersky can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
Canceled.

bors merge

Thanks!

bors merge

Thanks!

```suggestion

theorem dist_eq (p q : ℚ≥0) : dist p q = dist (p : ℚ) (q : ℚ) := rfl
theorem nndist_eq (p q : ℚ≥0) : nndist p q = nndist (p : ℚ) (q : ℚ) := rfl

```

Could even add
```lean
theorem sphere_eq (q : ℚ≥0) (r : ℝ) : Metric.sphere q r = (↑) ⁻¹' Metric.sphere (q : ℚ) r := rfl
theorem ball_eq (q : ℚ≥0) (r : ℝ) : Metric.ball q r = (↑) ⁻¹' Metric.ball (q : ℚ) r := rfl
theorem closedBall_eq (q : ℚ≥0) (r : ℝ) : Metric.closedBall q r = (↑) ⁻¹' Metric.closedBall (q : ℚ) r := rfl
```
but perhaps that's overkill

We have `Subtype.dist_eq` and `Subtype.nndist_eq` as rfl lemmas. Are those enough or do you want the specialized versions? Should those be `@[simp]` tagged so that they're dsimp-discoverable?

Would you like me to add the `sphere/ball/closedBall` lemmas for `Subtype` or specifically NNRat?

> ```suggestion
> 
> theorem dist_eq (p q : ℚ≥0) : dist p q = dist (p : ℚ) (q : ℚ) := rfl
> theorem nndist_eq (p q : ℚ≥0) : nndist p q = nndist (p : ℚ) (q : ℚ) := rfl
> 
> ```

I would make those simp and norm_cast backwards

Those aren't enough, because IIRC NNRat is not reducible, and so those lemmas won't apply.

It's fine to leave the sphere etc lemmas to a future PR, especially if you add them for Subtype + NNReal as well

I left them stated in the `dist_eq` direction but with
```
@[simp ←, push_cast]
```
Is that appropriate?
Does the `push_cast` attribute even exist?

Yes:
```
import Mathlib

instance : MetricSpace ℚ≥0 :=
  Subtype.metricSpace

@[simp ←, push_cast]
lemma dist_eq (p q : ℚ≥0) : dist p q = dist (p : ℚ) (q : ℚ) := rfl
@[simp ←, push_cast]
lemma nndist_eq (p q : ℚ≥0) : nndist p q = nndist (p : ℚ) (q : ℚ) := rfl

example (x y : ℚ≥0) : dist (x : ℚ) y = dist x y := by
  norm_cast

example (x y : ℚ≥0) : dist (x : ℚ) y = dist x y := by
  simp? says simp only [← dist_eq]
```
Isn't `push_cast` the same as `norm_cast`? That is, the latter auto-detects that `push_cast` is appropriate?

No, the attributes don't work the same way:
```
import Mathlib

instance : MetricSpace ℚ≥0 :=
  Subtype.metricSpace

@[push_cast]
lemma dist_eq (p q : ℚ≥0) : dist p q = dist (p : ℚ) (q : ℚ) := rfl
@[norm_cast] -- norm_cast: badly shaped lemma, lhs must contain at least one coe dist p q
lemma dist_eq' (p q : ℚ≥0) : dist p q = dist (p : ℚ) (q : ℚ) := rfl
```

> Isn't `push_cast` the same as `norm_cast`? That is, the latter auto-detects that `push_cast` is appropriate?

This sounds like lost Lean 3 behaviour

pullRequest.title: feat(Topology/Instance/Rat): add missing NNRat metric space
